DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study was to investigate whether urinary catheterization could be avoided for all patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty under combined spinal-epidural analgesia plus multi-site infiltration analgesia.
DOC.brief_title: To Catheterize or Not? in Total Knee Arthroplasty With Combined Spinal-epidural Analgesia
DOC.criteria: Aged 40 years and older, who were scheduled for a primary TKA for endstage osteoarthritis and those who were willing and able to return for followup over at least a 1month postoperative period. Revisions, bilateral procedures, surgical history of urinary system, urinary tract infection and systematical conditions (renal disease, renal failure, chronic renal insufficiency, or an indwelling catheter at the time of surgery) needing intraoperative monitoring urine output.
